name: CreateBreakType
description:
Create a new BreakType template for a location.

This tool creates a new BreakType, which is a template for establishing Break objects. Required inputs include location ID, break name, expected duration, and payment status. Note that each location can have a maximum of three BreakType instances.

parameters.name: location_id
parameters.description: The ID of the business location where this break type will apply. It is required to associate the break type with a specific location.

value_schema.description: The ID of the business location this type of break applies to.

parameters.name: break_name
parameters.description: A human-readable name for the break type, displayed to team members.

value_schema.description:
A human-readable name for this type of break. The name is displayed to
team members in Square products.

parameters.name: break_expected_duration
parameters.description: The expected length of the break in RFC-3339 duration format (e.g., PT15M for 15 minutes).

value_schema.description:
Format: RFC-3339 P[n]Y[n]M[n]DT[n]H[n]M[n]S. The expected length of
this break. Precision less than minutes is truncated.

Example for break expected duration of 15 minutes: PT15M

parameters.name: is_break_paid
parameters.description: Indicates if the break counts towards compensated work time. Use true for a paid break, false for an unpaid break.

value_schema.description:
Whether this break counts towards time worked for compensation
purposes.

parameters.name: idempotency_key
parameters.description: A unique string to ensure the operation is idempotent, avoiding duplicate actions.

value_schema.description: A unique string value to ensure the idempotency of the operation.

parameters.name: break_type_uuid
parameters.description: The UUID for the BreakType object. It uniquely identifies the break type.

parameters.name: concurrency_version
parameters.description: Integer for resolving concurrency issues; fails if it doesn't match server version.

value_schema.description:
Used for resolving concurrency issues. The request fails if the version
provided does not match the server version at the time of the request. If a value is not
provided, Square's servers execute a "blind" write; potentially
overwriting another writer's data.

parameters.name: created_at_timestamp
parameters.description: A read-only timestamp in RFC 3339 format, automatically populated and not required for input.

value_schema.description: A read-only timestamp in RFC 3339 format.

parameters.name: updated_at_timestamp
parameters.description: A read-only timestamp in RFC 3339 format indicating when the BreakType was last updated.

value_schema.description: A read-only timestamp in RFC 3339 format.
